intro: Cymopterus basalticus, commonly known as the basaltic evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its yellow, tubular flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils, often found in areas with basaltic substrates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Cymopterus basalticus is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important species in xerophytic ecosystems.
